The combat of this game is incredibly fun and stylish, with a bunch of weapons with unique movesets and a bunch of characters with unique skillsets, and it's also very skillful and has the quality of being easy to play, hard to master. It really does feel like a fighting game battle royale.

The presentation and environment design are also top-notch. I'd often have to stop myself from just staring at a nice landscape and get back to looting. I really like the character and weapon designs, and it makes me want to whale to look as cool as I can.

Battle royale isn't the only mode, there's also deathmatch, a PvE campaign, a bunch more I haven't touched yet, and a new capture point team battle mode, and they're all fun since the core game is so well made.

The in-game purchases can get a little scumbaggy, but it's all strictly cosmetic so it won't interfere with you if you don't want to spend anything. Half of the cosmetics are still earnable for free, anyway.

And now that it's gone free to play, this is the easiest recommendation of my life. Give it a try, it's fun and unique, and it's one of the coolest games I've played.

Ternyata pilihan untuk membeli gim ini pada 2 tahun lalu tidak seburuk yang dibayangkan. Awalnya beli gim ini karena jenuh dengan DotA dan gim FPS selain itu karena kepincut karakter gim yang cantik. Sayangnya 2 tahun lalu gim ini tidak ramai di indonesia sehingga mencari komunitasnya sangat sulit dan saya berakhir vakum meski hanya bermain sebentar dan iseng beli bundle package skin Yoto Hime + battlepass iseng.
Kemudian ditahun ini, entah mengapa gim ini masih ramai dan dilihat-lihat selalu ada konten baru dan menarik. Saya langsung install lagi dan siapa sangka ternyata akan ada event menjadi Free to Play (tanggal 14 juli kemarin) diikuti dengan event teaser new class code name TESSA dan yang paling mengejutkan event yang saya tunggu 6/7 bulan lalu yang sempat dirumorkan dicancel akhirnya diumumin juga tanggal kolaborasi NARAKA x NIeR.

Semenjak event free to play dirilis serta cross dengan konsol saya akhirnya bersyukur karena sang dev membuat event untuk pemain yang sudah terlanjur beli pass gimnya dengan diberikan kompensasi 4960 gold), skin eksklusif, treasure dan event undang pemain baru. untuk saat ini saya sudah bisa bermain dengan damai karena bisa bertemu dengan orang indonesia. mungkin karena ini gim dari china makanya kurang diminati di indonesia. ü§£ü§£

Terima kasih untuk developer NARAKA:BLADEPOINT karena sudah membuat player seperti saya yang anti memakai karakter laki-laki dan lebih suka memakai karakter wanita betah bermain gim ini.

Fantastic, unique battle royale. Phenomenal combat system with a huge amount of depth. Definitely can be frustrating at first, but the game eases you in with bots to show you the ropes. Once you get the hang of it it‚Äôs an incredibly fun, tense, and rewarding combat experience. Best of all, this game has a solos mode! 

Much like Apex this game features characters with unique abilities. All the characters feel and play different, and levelling up your account let‚Äôs you select passive boosts that further help tailor the game to your play style. If you want to focus on fancy combos and getting your ult as quickly as possible, you can. If you want to have more options to escape tricky situations, you can. Also, the game has an incredibly detailed character creator that lets you customize the appearance of every character in the game (except the one character that is a crossover character from another Netease game). You can make some god awful monstrosities, or some incredibly faithful recreations of characters from other properties. I‚Äôve seen my fair share of Wukongs, Draculas, and even a comic accurate Drax the Destroyer running around. It‚Äôs very, very cool. 

The game definitely needs some work; performance and server stability can leave a lot to be desired. Drop the settings a bit (DLSS helps a ton if you have an nvidia card) and expect to lose a few games due to some unfortunate lag. Hopefully this gets ironed out with some patches. 

Highly recommend giving this game a go.

Overall good game. Spent a ton of hours on the xbox side of the game, and as a OG Naraka player overall good game. The downside to the game is the cross platform progression. It needs one because of the amount of gold spent and ranked progress I have (and people have).  Updates are regular and fighting is good for a (now free game). Only in game currency is gold and the cost is somewhat decent. In my opinion the skins and weapon skins are pricey (around 1,000) gold each and seems a little over the top but can't say much for a now free game. Only thing I could say i that they should lower the cost a little bit.

Overall would rec despite the cost of things in game

A fresh take on an extremely boring and overdone genre. 

I've played the open beta and had an enjoyable time only bogged down by some performance issues. Thankfully it seems they've ironed most of the them (while you may need to add a launch command here on steam), the performance increase and stability is very noticeable even on my old system.

Yes there are bots for the first few games to ease you into the mechanics. If you want to get your teeth kicked in real quick, just queue ranked and only ranked. The faster you climb, the faster you'll get destroyed :^)

I only play trios with randos and I've been having a lot of fun even as someone that really dislikes BRs.

If you think not being able to cancel every single move is "clunky", you might not like this, even if it isn't slow.
Movement system is very good and weapons have a nice feel to each of them, the animations are flashy and the fights get tense.

Using a mix of medium(majority) and low settings(volumetric fog, post processing etc), at native 1080p. I get a very smooth experience and the visuals are still decent.  (anti-aliasing SMAA on high)

no regrets, definitely worth the small price for entry.

I have been playing Naraka on and off for the last few years always ranking between top 2%-0.4% and every time I come back to play I forget how amazing this game really is but also reminded why I stopped playing in the first place.

Naraka is best described for me as a Battle Royal 3d Fighting game with expressive movement and sword-play combat as the primary focus. I could have wrote an essay on how much there is wrong with the game many years ago but the Devs have been fine tuning this game over regular updates over the years it's been out and the balance is in a relatively acceptable place as it stands. 

Pros - Expressive movement base game, high mind games, incredibly high skill ceiling at the later ranks. High levels of customisation, lots of events and rewards, cool characters and weapons, consistent map and loot placings. Combat feels fluid and incredibly satisfying once it clicks, good lobby system, customisation of games, lots of game modes and possibly the highest character customisation almost to date, rivals even SF6 custom character abominations. 

Cons - They fixed huge amounts of the cons over the years. The match making placing you in 150+ ping lobbies is frustrating and unavoidable without a VPN. The net code isn't good enough to handle anything over 100ms. Queue times are very long in the later ranks but smooth games below plat. High level of bots in the lobbies of lower games to fill out numbers, circle closes in too slowly, would be nicer if it was 15mins games max instead of 20-35mins.

Reasons of me quitting was due to the match making which has mostly been solved.
Would I recommend this? yes for sure, if you're a fan of fighting games or BR games or sword based combat PVP games? absolutely. There is also PVE modes if you're garbage at playing PVP skill based games and can only deal with scripted fights with bots/NPCs.

Feel good bots. When I played on release, I was curious about why the devs had decided to use bots. That's because they use them in PvP (*PLAYER* vs *PLAYER*) game modes where it's supposed to be full of people. Not only that, but the only indication that they were bots was certain animation jank involving the grappling hook. The answer? Despite what other reviews say, it wasn't an issue of population. They were prevalent even on release in all queues. No, it was an issue of psychology. If you feel good playing the game, you will be more likely to buy microtransactions. Minion Masters also sneakily does the same thing. No thanks. I'll wait until they can physically make me feel good. 

PSA look up click farms and maybe you'll see why 2000 positive reviews consist of the words "cool game".

Nicely done environment. unique and smooth movements and attacks combos, nice looking characters and weapons...
Nice different take on the Battle Royale Formula, Slick melee combat and interesting character skills. Much fun and makes me feel way cooler than I could hope to be in real life.  :P

*** AFTER 700+ HOURS ***
Naraka continues to be fun. I've only ranked Platinum on the NA servers, so I'm very middle of the road, but I never quite feel like I've hit a wall on my progress learning as I've experienced with other PvP games. The game remains fun and rewarding, even if I lose. The community is very helpful, and offers feedback to improve. In my previous review I compared the game to other Battle Royale games, but as the game develops I can't ignore how much skill is involved... like a Street Fighter or Tekken fighter. Sometimes queues for ranked games can take a while, but the matchmaking is really fair. ...and if queues take too long, campaign mode, and bot training modes are great to test your skill. Bots on hard have been talked about as Hax (Heh!), so you won't have to worry about getting bored and running out of ways to challenge yourself.

It's been years since I've had a game that didn't make me lose interest after this long. Great Game.

*** AFTER 4.5 HOURS ***
I love this game. I don't quite know how to describe how much I love it, but I'm going to try. There are games, special games, that require skill and strategy, where the competition is fierce and the difference between a champion and just a player comes into rare and clear focus. Starcraft is like this, so is League of Legends, or Fortnite.

This game is such a perfect blend of all the things I love... it's like Tenchu: Stealth Assassins combined with Dynasty Warriors and maybe Tekken or Street Fighter; then wrapped up with Starcraft or League of Legends cosmetic stores and leader boards with a soup√ßon of Battle Royale mechanics.

Having most of the weapons in the game be melee really makes the combat great, and meaningful. Combos, interrupts, disarming your opponent and martial arts are all things you can do... or if you're like me, mostly you have it done TO you. Yet, in spite of how awful I am at this game, I can still enjoy it, because you really viscerally feel that the other person beat you because they were clearly the superior player, and not because they had an aim-bot or anything like that.

I can also enjoy the game, because of how overwhelmingly beautiful it is. The settings are great, and detailed, and yet subtly muted so as to allow the vibrant color of the characters to shine through; like anime characters bursting with all their color and outrageous animation into the real world, the contrast between the mundane and the fantastic allows you to always feel like the main character. The balance of the aesthetic is perfect. The little details like the sound of running across clay shingles on a rooftop, contribute not only to the immersion of the game, but also strategically. It's hard to be stealthy while "clank-clank-clank" you're running over terra cotta shingles, and it impacts your game play.

I will likely update this review later, because I've only just scratched the surface of this game. The one thing that put is head and shoulders above the rest, is you can tell that this game was the labor of love for a great many people. It's worthy of being called art, as well as a game.

A seriously fun and competitive take on the Battle Royale game mode.

Are you a fan of martial arts and have been looking for a game to satisfy your needs? This is it.

You will in this game find:
Solo, Duo and Trios queue (Rating (V-IIII-III-II-I) :
Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Solar, Empyrean, Astral, Asura, Unrivaled Asura. 
There is also the option of Quick Match. 

Expect a healthy number of bots in any mode - however they have been given some varying levels of AI difficulty and some are wired to be able to face Unrivaled Asura players. Do not take all bots lightly *wink*. 

You will find alternate game modes. These alternate game modes aren't available at all times as the player base heavily fluctuates in is online hours. 

9 unique melee weapons with unique abilities.
7 unique ranged weapons.
16 unique heroes with unique abilities. (3 Varieties of your F ability and 3 varieties of your V (ultimate) ability)

Climb your way up and ranked and you will verse more players, who are also more experienced. 
Expect a lot of bots on the way to greatness. It's to smooth the learning curve as well as to keep you occupied. Do not despair x)

You can practice the different modes through ranked, quick matches and custom rooms. 
Game sense and overall prowess is best trained through Herald's Trial and mechanics are probably best trained in Custom room/Training Grounds. This is also a muscle memory and strategy game. 

Hope this helps.

Naraka is pretty much what I expected after the open Beta. They drastically improved the FPS drops that haunted players while loading in the first 10 sec of each round. They also added a few new weapons and characters. 

Its an amazing Battle Royale without heavily leaning on being one. What I mean by that is eventhough the game is basically a BR it often feels like an action MMO. Unlike most BR games you are not getting hard rolled by other players if you have a rough start and youre not finding super good gear. The skill sealing is so high that as a good player all you need is a white armor and a white melee weapon (I feel like having only 1 ranged weapon makes it almost impossible to win a close on 1v1) to outplay a worse player that has better gear than you.


The room for improvement is so damn high that you cant just practice your aim to get better you actually somewhat need to learn how each character and each weapon plays in order to counter them, which is a great thing in my opinion.

P2W? Microtransactions?
No P2W only cosmetics, they pretty much have everything in the MT universe: Different Game Packages, Loot Boxes, Purchasable Cosmetics, A Battle Pass, pick your poison.

Edit: I still stand by what I said after 20 hrs the only thing is now that I dont have lobbies full of bots I have 6+ minute queu timers. Unlike most people I actually prefer having 80% of my lobby as bots as long as I can play the game. Almost everyone plays ranked (same goes for me) but even in ranked (currently platinum 2) it takes so long to find game which is okay for games like league where you have alteast 20 minute games but in battle royales this is frustrating for obvious reason. I dont mind meeting a stronger opponent but waiting 8 minutes just to be one comboed by sb who is lv 1600 is not fun.
That being sad if you enjoy BRs and especially enjoy real time action combat based MMOs such as Black Desert Online, Tera or Vindictus I feel like you cant do anything wrong with Naraka.

Really enjoy the game but it's annoying when you get into higher ranks and it's just chinese players abusing cheesy mechanics.[/strike]

EDIT: after much consideration and realizing the dying state of this game, I gave it one last chance when they released their newest character Zai.

[h1]Biggest problems/concerns:[/h1]
- Low player count and bot problem. Bots are absolutely not helpful in learning this game, they serve no purpose and are only a nuisance because there are different types of bots, one's that run away and waste your time, and one's that spam staggering attacks. You will likely get 1 or 2 teams in your lobbies and sometimes you will play against all bots.

- Ranked system is absolute garbage. with the diminishing playerbase already, you will hardly fight new players to Naraka, and most of the time you'll run into player's who are unrivaled asura's (max rank) in gold lobbies. 

- Naraka's Partnership with Gameboosting / Latency software proves that they don't care about who plays on NA servers and cater to the losers who switch from EU or Asia servers onto NA servers. 

- Hacking / Report system.
 - There are so many hackers who move over to NA servers to cheat and get away with it. why? because Naraka's report system is the worst report system I've seen in ANY game. You can put in a report for hacking, it will then ASK YOU for a clip of it along with so much other useless information like the suspects name / in-game ID. How can you report someone who's using chinese characters in their name if you can't even fucking read their name to begin with?

- Characters are extremely unbalanced. Like to play as a healer? well prepare to get stomped by awful players who abuse cheesy character's and ultimate's that literally give them a panic ultimate and a full health bar with EXTREMELY overpowered damage and long lasting ultimate's that almost never have any counters (Tianhai/Yueshan).

- This game does not have 60,000+ players like the community tab says on Steam, It is likely this game has around 100 ~ 300 players as a more accurate figure.

- Cosmetics are being pumped out with every update as they ignore everything else wrong with the game. And your cosmetics can be changed at any time to be censored when the developers wish to do so.

- Leaderboard is flooded with Chinese / EU players

- Optimization is horrible, and for latency NA servers will give around 50 ~ 90 ping. and it's really inconsistent.

- Teaming in ranked matches is very likely to happen as there is such a shortage of players and you will see it happen.

- Tarka Ji ultimate still has not been nerfed to remove his unlimited uppercut stunlock.

[h1]Final thoughts / Closure[/h1]
As a beta player and someone who really looked forward to this game succeeding, it's just a very sad feeling that this game will not succeed outside of China. It is a very fun and rewarding game when you play against people your skill level and have fair fights, but that is only about 10% of your playtime, the other 90% will be you dying to chinese losers abusing their elevated ping and auto parry software, fighting the most absurd bots only to realize you might have just won a full game against just bots.

[b]DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. I'D RATHER YOU SPEND $20 ON LITERALLY ANYTHING ELSE.[/b]

One of the best battle royales i have played and i have played them all since h1z1. I don't know why it hasn't taken off yet.

unforgiving, but good combat mechanics. They really make you learn the weapons instead of swinging wildly. Really in-depth character customization if that's your thing. Like REALLY in-depth. Not many people using cheats. There's a few here and there but its rare. overall I've really enjoyed the game. the battle pass is all cosmetics. everything is cosmetics. The battle pass gives a balanced amount of rewards. It's worth it due to the steady stream of in-game materials that you can't just buy with gold. same thing for the cosmetics. a lot of them can't be bought with gold. There is a large satisfaction in skin achievements because you know you only have it because you earned it. They're constantly releasing content and limited-time events. there's a lot and they're all good and unique.There's also a "story" mode where you team up and accomplish tasks and kill bosses. There's a separate level up system from anything in the game. kind of like another game mode. It takes a hell of a lot of effort to progress and continue and its satisfying seeing your progress. The levels get easier and easier until you hit the next tier and then its super hard again.overall i'd give it an 8.7/10score reduction due to minor/medium character and combo imbalances in the main Battle Royale modes.

EDIT 4/6/2023: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. There are so many hackers you can't play a match without being cheated. The devs are doing nothing about it.

EDIT 6/3/2023 Its fine. They fixed the cheaters. I'm sure it'll happen again but its not like The Cycle where it just got completely fucked off with cheaters. They fixed the issue. It's a great game again.

Decided to review the game another time, 500 hours later. Let's start with the good things.

Naraka is a really good game with high skill cap. The game has the most fluid movement and combat system in all of the competitive games I've played. It builds around its basic movements and feels very intuitive. The combat implements an intricate rock-paper-scissors system. So to speak, you'll go very far with strong fundamentals!

Each mode is a lot different from each other. If you thrive in chaos, play trios. If you like simpler fights, flexing and trying out different combo variations, solos might be for you. I personally enjoy duos because it's not too chaotic, but its balance make for interesting fights.

Now with its bad sides: depending on your region, most matches (especially until platinum) will be filled with bots. Worst case, you're the only real person in your match. As new players grind their way up (past platinum), they'll start finding the huge skill gap between them and players who have learned their fundamentals. To add salt to the injury, lobbies will often be filled with players way, way beyond their elo.

Here's to wishing Naraka gets a wake up call to market the game outside China.

Anyway, give it a try. I promise it's an insanely fun game. Every fight almost feels like a highlight reel.

Exceptional.

The incredibly fluid movement options makes traversal fun, so the typical downtime of battle royales isn't nearly as boring. 

Combat is fairly balanced with character abilities making you feel powerful while being manageable to fight against. Combat is fairly simple at the surface, but with the many advance techs, cancels and movement options you can deploy to mix up your opponent, the meta game becomes deep quickly. What I especially like is that, even at a top level, finding counterplay doesn't seem impossible nor does it seem like it becomes a "just dont get hit" kind of game. There is a good amount of guessing and bluffing involved, so you always have to play against the player's mind, rather than just trying to land some killer combo starter (this is what most online fighters become). There is always room to improve and the reason you lose is often plain to see.

The music is good. The PvE content is solid. There are custom rooms available. There are good tutorials, videos, explanations and training modes available.

Key Lime Pie Ingredients
These are the five ingredients you'll need to make this top-rated Key lime pie recipe:

¬∑ Sweetened condensed milk: This sweet, smooth, and creamy Key lime pie starts with a can of sweetened condensed milk.
¬∑ Key lime juice: Key lime juice comes from the Florida Keys. Key limes are more acidic than regular limes, so they pack a flavorful punch.
¬∑ Sour cream: Sour cream contributes to the rich texture and lends subtly tangy flavor.
¬∑ Lime zest: A tablespoon of lime zest enhances the bold citrusy flavor.
¬∑ Graham cracker crust: Use a store-bought or homemade graham cracker crust.

How to Make Key Lime Pie
Making Key lime pie at home couldn't be easier. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below ‚Äì but here's a brief overview of what you can expect:

1. Make the filling: Combine the filling ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Pour into the prepared graham cracker crust.
2. Bake the pie: Bake the pie in a preheated oven until tiny bubbles appear and pop on the surface of the pie.
3. Cool the pie: Allow the pie to cool on a wire rack, then transfer it to the refrigerator to finish setting. Top with whipped cream and lime wedges, if desired.

How to Store Key Lime Pie
Cover the cooled Key lime pie tightly with storage wrap or foil. Store in the refrigerator for up to three days. Serve chilled.

Can You Freeze Key Lime Pie?
Yes! You can freeze Key lime pie for up to three months (but make sure you don't add whipped cream or toppings until after it's thawed). If you plan to freeze the pie, bake it in a foil pan. Wrap the cooled pie in at least one layer of storage wrap, then follow it up with at least one layer of foil. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight.

Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise
"I love this recipe, it's fabulous," says Stephanie White. "I also experimented and used lemon in place of the lime (just to find a use for my over abundance of lemons) and it turned out great."

"This Key lime pie is delicious," raves Debidoooo. "I make a homemade graham cracker crust and add one-third cup of toasted shredded coconut to the crust. Everyone raves about this pie. Try it‚Ä¶..you won't be disappointed."

"This recipe was excellent," raves one Allrecipes community member. "The only change I made was to substitute plain yogurt for the sour cream because I didn't have any. Everyone enjoyed it."

Ingredients
3 cups sweetened condensed milk

¬æ cup key lime juice

¬Ω cup sour cream

1 tablespoon grated lime zest

1 (9 inch) prepared graham cracker crust

Directions
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Combine condensed milk, key lime juice, sour cream, and lime zest in a bowl; mix well. Pour into graham cracker crust; place pie on a baking sheet.

Bake in the preheated oven for 5 to 8 minutes, until tiny pinhole bubbles burst on the surface of the pie. The filling will be wobbly but not browned.

Transfer pie to a wire rack to cool, then thoroughly chill pie in the refrigerator before serving, about 1 hour. Garnish with lime slices and whipped cream.

Its a really fun game. It does have its issues, however. I am not that high in ranked; I am only in Solar, yet I seem to always go against server top players. I know this is probably because the games playerbase isn't large enough to support me only fighting people the same rank as me, but man it can be frustrating sometimes. The same with quick play, except the opposite. I seem to mostly fight bots in quick play. The movement and combat are both satisfying. There is almost always an event of some sort going on so you don't have to just play the game to play the game if that is something that you don't like. It is a very fun game to play with friends as well. Working on team compositions and finding out which characters click with others is a lot of fun to do. The most annoying issue that I had has thankfully been resolved. Xbox and steam players, whether or not on PC, could technically join the same lobby but could not friend each other or play with each other directly. They fixed that thankfully. Now for some reason we still can't join each others "Chambers" (Kind of like a guild but not really). Anyway, this game was definitely worth the price. I wouldn't recommend getting sucked into the lootbox mechanics though. The rates are atrocious, but thankfully the things in loot boxes are purely cosmetic.

Most fun I've had in a game in a long while. Movement feels GOOD, fighting is fast-paced and varied, skill ceiling is sky-high. The game is also so pretty it gave my eyes type two diabetes. I wish EU servers had more mid- and high tier players for exciting battles and to learn from - you definitely feel a difference between peak hours and slower times. So if you're on the verge, please do join! üôè And don't get discouraged if you get clapped after a few early bot matches, just watch a few YT vids for beginner tips and you'll be able to enjoy this fun and beautiful game with the rest of us. If you ever played Sekiro, you'll be right at home with the grappling hooks, counter system, dodge i-frames and managing stamina.
If you like stuttering issues and playing/fighting with bots, then this game is for you.

Great game, friendly community.

Requires fast SSD/M.2.
Crossplay with Xbox players.
Game servers in EU, NA, AS, SEA, China. There is no SA server, so ppl from that region will have 200+ ms ping (pretty much unplayable).
Supports keyboard + mouse and gamepads.
Game has own anticheat system. 
All in-game micro transactions are cosmetics. No pay2win. Pay to look better) 
Frequent content updates (season passes and time limited events). 
If you want to know, what edition is best (Standard, Deluxe or Ultimate) - it is Standard + Season Pass unlock (+10$).

Game modes: Survival Ranked/Casual (Battle Royale), Bloodbath (Deathmatch with bots and players, matchmaking waiting time is 4 minute right now), Showdown (PVE for 3 players, but it is possible to play in Duos and Solo, if ppl are "Gut". Time limited - only for Friday, Saturday and Sunday), Bot mode (Survival with bots - 3 level of difficulty), Room matches (players only, PvP). And some other time limited modes. 

Game mechanics. Since it is close combat game (with ranged weapon elements), you need to adapt to your enemies. It is not look&kill shooter game. It is not masher simulator either, like DMC, because of parry system (from souls-like and fighting games). 

There is no block button at all, but Greatsword and Polesword have blocking properties. 

There is light (fast), charged (blue, slow) attack and parry. If you got stunned with any light attack, you can't do charge attack, but you can dodge after stun at some point. If you started charged attack before enemy hit you with light - you have priority and you will make good damage. But charged attacks can be parried. And you can't parry light attacks. So it is triangle system. Because of different ping, parry timing will differ too - some ppl play with 40 ms ping, others - with 140 e t.c. 

Fast movement and fast retreat/recover is mandatory. Also two types of dodges (click shift/hold shift) require proper stamina management. 

There are lots of stuff, that you can do in the game (upgrade account level, upgrade weapon level, hero cultivation e t.c.). More than 10 heroes already, some of them are free and others you can buy with in-game currency(tae/silver). 

Combat depends on weapon you use(katana, dagger, spear, long sword...), characters just have some additional features (skills and ultimates). 

Currency in game: gold (real money). If you pay for season pass unlock and complete it fully, you will receive all gold back (+-1200 gold). Silver - tae, you will receive basically for doing anything useful) Same with silk. Dark coins - you use to buy stuff in survival mode from special chest (Rift dealer). Also there is special season pass coins. 3x coins, if you complete task in survival mode, will grant you +1 season pass level. Usually season pass has 130 lv, last SP was shorter. For fast SP grind you need to complete daily, weekly and monthly (season) tasks. From usual matches you will get not so much exp. 

Keep in mind, than in Survival Ranked first you will play only against easy bots - to understand whole game better. Only with ppl you will play at Platinum rank and higher. But matchmaking time will be longer too. Usually more ppl in the evening and very few or nobody in the morning. So this is not a game, where you can play all day (if you want to play with real ppl). 

Overall it is a great game and developers/publishers support it, constantly making new stuff. 
Because of lack of ppl in EU/NA region, it is difficult to be a main game. 
But for few hours after work it is good enough for sure) 

All usual quests and 95% of achievements you can do solo in bot mode. Exception are: The Overcomer, Hand of Grace, Fickle Fortune. The most annoying achievement is Accuracy Assured, where you need to level up ranged weapon to 25 lv. Basically all my time in this game was about completing this one achievement)

Naraka takes all the classic elements of the Battle Royale - sixty players fighting for supremacy on a large map, weapons and equipment randomly distributed, players choosing where to drop, and an ever-shrinking circle driving everyone towards the center and a final confrontation, and adds something totally new; Tight 3d melee combat in the lineage of 2d fighting games like Street Fighter, Tekken, or Mortal Combat. 

The player has to combine their chosen hero's abilities with a wide assortment of weapons to put together a combat strategy. It's essential to learn combos, juggles, synergies between different weapons, characters, and powers, as well as building map knowledge to survive. The skill floor is high, but reaching it is very rewarding. 

For the fashionistas the game offers a lot of character customization. There are paid cosmetics and a battle pass, but the game is pretty generous about free cosmetics and a lot of the cooler high end cosmetics are available through gameplay. 

The game features a bunch of side-modes alongside the main BR mode. There's ranked and unranked BR, a death-match mode that's great for practicing, a neat PvE mode with unique mechanics, various alternate BR modes with different loot rules and a much smaller, more aggressive circle, and a fully featured practice mode where you can experiment with all the weapons and practice against AI bots that can be set to be passive, defensive, or aggressive. 

The game uses bots to fill out matches and the NA servers can be spartan off peak hours and at low ELOs, something to keep in mind. 

Overall I strongly recommend it to anyone who finds the idea of crossing a fighting game with a BR compelling and wants a challenging experience that rewards diligent practice, strategy, cunning, and and fast precise inputs.

Its not an easy to pick up game if you dont have experience playing melee based PVP games. Learning from other players in the game or watching extra youtube guides is highly recommended to know about (movement) mechanics the game is relatively poor at explaining.

The problems the West (NA, EU etc.) is facing with this game are a mild concern:
- Player population is pretty low for a battle royale, queue times are relatively long compared to popular online games. Marketing is low, while the game is pretty popular in China.
- They currently use bots to fill up quickmatch and even ranked games, due to the lower playerbase and not wanting to have super long queues. The amount of real players increases in ranked when you hit gold/platinum+ rank.
- The ranked matchmaking is sometimes unfair. There is a big skill gap between players but because the pop is low it is possible that you (as a noob - average player) and the best players in the game are getting matched together.
- The servers: mid netcode and other players having high(er) latency... ultimately the game is playable but sometimes parry windows are not functioning like you expect.
- your imputs might not always come through due to the earlier mentioned server state or your pc not being that high end. For some reason higher FPS (and Hz) makes your imputs a tiny amount more responsive. A hard requirement also is installing the game on a SSD. Dont even try to play this on a HDD.

I do think it is a shame that this game is overlooked by many or not given a fair shake due to having some yanky mechanics that arent that easy to pick up as a new player. It is very rewarding when you get better at it.
I do hope that Netease and the developers will give the West a little bit more love too though, as it goes both ways.

Holy cow. This game looks and plays so well. There is a multitude of weapons to choose from, similarly, a buttload of combos and mechanics to mix and match. I love coming up each day after work and improving at the game. Honestly, it's super fun! The counter is a big thing in Naraka, and each counter feels so fucking satisfying. The characters are okay, not super balanced (e.g. Takeda), but still pretty good. There are multiple unranked modes which you can use to improve yourself.

Note: I play solo in SEA servers. I haven't played ranked and haven't reached LVL 20 yet. I do, however, play Herald's Trial, i.e. Quick Match, which feels _really_ good when you win knowing you _just_ beat a bunch of real players xD You also gradually learn the difference between a bot vs a player. I might edit this review when I get to rank matches, but overall, I am having lots of fun. It's been a while since I last played a BR game and had this much fun, even SOLO.

P.S: For someone who is a fan of King's avatar (ÂÖ®ËÅåÈ´òÊâã) and the game they play in it, this is it!

Edit: So, 118+ hours later, I still fully recommend the game, even if I get my a** handed to me at times. It's super fun and challenging at the same time. Winning combat is still as satisfying as when I first started playing the game :)

Difficult in the 'easy to learn, hard to master' type of way. What I mean by that is: If you don't play fighting games or have the capacity to sit in a training room for extended periods practicing how to move and fight, you're gonna have a bad time.
The movement in this game is similar to GunZ the Duel (arguably a bit harder) but like any super mechanical game it all comes down to muscle memory so practice practice practice and it becomes easy... until you get outplayed by someone who exploits your unrefined movement and fighting ability. So, hop back into training and beat them later :)

When you start ranking, you'll either have really stupid easy mode bots in your game or bots who seem to 0 frame parry every blue/charge attack. There will be actual players sprinkled in as your rank increases. 
Once you reach gold or platinum rank-- which doesn't take too long once you get comfortable btw, you will start playing versus some of the best players in the game.

Good luck.

Naraka: Blade Point is a free-to-play battle royale game developed and published by 24 Entertainment. It takes place in a mystical world where players will fight to be the last one standing. The game offers a unique blend of melee and ranged combat, which makes it stand out from other battle royale games.

The graphics of the game are impressive, and the environment is beautifully designed. The game features an impressive character customization system, allowing players to create a unique character according to their preferences.

The gameplay of Naraka: Blade Point is fast-paced and intense, requiring players to master various weapons and skills. The combat system is unique, combining traditional melee and ranged combat, making it more challenging and exciting.

The game also features several modes, including a six-player team mode, which adds more depth to the gameplay experience. Additionally, the game offers a decent tutorial that helps players to understand the basic mechanics of the game.

Overall, Naraka: Blade Point is an exciting and challenging game that offers a unique combination of melee and ranged combat. The game is free-to-play on Steam, making it accessible to a broader audience. If you enjoy battle royale games and want to try something different, Naraka: Blade Point is worth checking out.

[EDIT] Primary issues with the game still remain prominent, those being: High ping Chinese players on NA, the loot box/RNG is a monetary scam, and the game needs to be made F2P. People look at the steamcharts and think the game is healthy, while failing to realise 90% of the players aren't even on NA. Either remove loot boxes, make them cheaper, or make the game free. Western servers are dying. 
[EDIT]
Highly competitive, BR aspect is not as much as you would think, however I wish solos map was a bit smaller. Overall, fantastic game; monetisation method is eeeehhhh since it is pay to play, but it is cosmetic overall so it doesn't entirely matter, plus the battle pass is very well worth the price. RNG on loot boxes is, well, random. I have had relatively good RNG so far, opening 23 chests and getting 9 epics.
I do recommend this game only to people who can have fun in competitive play as even the low level play is very high with Chinese players on VPNs, so definitely do research on the game and the mechanics if you are interested in the game. It feels like a less arthritis-inducing GUNZ to me.
Do expect this game to become an ESPORT once the devs have interest in investing towards that as the game is most certainly only going to grow.

Even though I'm not a big fan of survival games, I bought Naraka to try something new.
The game is considered competitive, but I would say it is more a game of luck. Those who are lucky to find a better drop - have more chances to win. Some characters have weird hitboxes, the parry is not always working, and some weapons are extremely strong, I would even say broken. 
I really like the aesthetics and environment, the assets look cool as hell and customizations are beautiful, but it would be better to be able to change the top, bottom and shoes apart instead of choosing one single skin. It's weird that you can customize your character's face even more in detail than in sims, but you don't have too much choice with the clothes.
In order to make this game more competitive it would be fine to do an adjustment of the battle system, because i feel like it's not fair to be defeated with 3 hits broken pole, or the focus of the katana that it's almost impossible to parry as the player can release the charge button  when he wants and you can't predict.
The only thing you may have to learn is the combos of each weapon to try to parry them when they are on blue focus, IF YOU HAVE LUCK the parry may work!
Also bots may be annoying because they can see you through the walls and even when you are hiding in the bushes.
Despite all that, I like the game because the feeling of being more lucky next time and winning keeps you excited for hours.

Have steep learning curve, but its worth your time and money.

[h1]For anyone wondering about a HVCI_KMCI_81 error:[/h1][b]Firstly[/b], this requires you to go to Windows Search Bar -> Core Isolation -> Disabling Memory Integrity.[b]Secondly[/b], there's a lot of discourse whether the anti cheat software that comes with NARAKA: BLADEPOINT consists of a virus, since the program requires access to your Windows Kernel in order to run. If you are wondering why this is a potential problem, I'd recommend googling the implications that come with disabling memory integrity. But for those who don't want, core isolation essentially protects core windows processes from being accessed by potentially malicious software, by disabling it, you're essentially exposing these processes to potential hackers that can tamper with them.As for whether said anticheat does contain a virus is very unlikely. Other games have built in anticheats that also access the Windows Kernel driver, such as RIOT Vanguard that is necessary to run Valorant. The only difference between these two systems is that Valorant prompts you to grant it permission to run in the kernel upon installation, whereas NARAKA asks you to disable it so it can access it, and with the fact that both games have been out for years and neither have had any legal actions against them aside from multiple [i](valid)[/i] suspicions means that they may both share the same trait of being safe to use.Considering the large amount of players and the plethora of positive reviews, I would doubt that the game comes with a virus. Those that claim that it's another Chinese game that the government are using to spy on machines, though could be right since there is a possibility for anything, are most likely over-exaggerating how dangerous this game is, especially since it's been reviewed by IGN & GameSpot and is available on PC and consoles including Xbox and PlayStation, the latter not even having a memory integrity for you to disable in the first place.[i]And if you're worried about your data being sold, I can guarantee that you've browsed enough of the internet to have that happen multiple times by now.[/i][i][b]TL;DR[/b], anticheat probably isn't a virus but the way the game wants to run is super sus and I'd hope they change it in the future. As for the game, it's a lot of fun. For me, it was an alternate to Spellbreak after it shut down earlier this year and, although I do prefer Spellbreak, it's a great choice for someone who loved the game like myself.[/i]And if I'm wrong about all of this and the game is revealed to have ratted all your computers, don't blame me xoxo

[h1]Barely playable, but not because it's poor quality...[/h1]

Yeah reinstalled to try to get into a match... dead game is dead... 40k players in China maybe...

What It Is:
A battle royale focused around melee combat rather than guns. This is actually a lot more entertaining than you would think, with movement being a big part of the gameplay.

Gameplay:
A very combo heavy, methodical combat which requires you to be on your toes constantly, especially when fighting multiple enemies at once. Movement skills are a must, quick inputs and good timing are necessary. It's to the walls at all times.

Difficulty:
Skill ceiling is not visible.

Graphics:
Pretty good, they aren't the best or groundbreaking but you won't be disappointed by them by any means. Personally I like my frames so I run them low.

Audio:
Fantastic 360 degree immersive sound.

Replay Value:
Depends how far your patience goes. This game is a true test of it.

What I Like:
The combat is unique, the gameplay is fast paced, the animations are smooth. Everything is here for this game to be really nice and unique and fun to play.

What I Don't:
Nerfed a large portion of the games movement via scale rush, and haven't address any of the realistic balance problems the game has. 

I don't even have fun anymore, every single match in Gold V to Gold I and back down again is just a bunch of SEA sweatlards and it's ruining the NA gameplay, not to mention local leaderboards are broken because of CN players using VPNs (RIP to being #1 in my state since randomly one day an Asian player was at the top :shrug:)

Leaderboards are infested with boosters using new accounts/friends to drop ELO and farm.

Improper teaming within Asian teams is common at higher ranks (they like killing NAs).

Hitboxes are buggy (both because of latency/netcode and because they aren't very accurate).

Parry has reached a state of full uselessness.

There is NO proper ranked system for matches. You'll be matched with Silvers in Plat, and Plats in Bronze. It literally is just a clusterfrick at this point. As of this review I am Gold IV and have been Plat once, and in that time I have seen more Plats as a Gold IV than I ever did as a plat. It's goofy as hell.

I wouldn't buy this game to be honest. The devs show no interest in fixing common and REAL player complaints, instead erring on the side of using surveys which are vastly weighted in favor of the CN player answers (most of whom all main the broken characters/weps so they never receive the nerfs they need.)

It's amazing how poor controls in this game are. If you attack, you have to wait for 1-2 seconds to be able to move or do anything other than continuing hitting. So if the opponent decides to run away, you have to stand still waiting, while he's hopping one thousand miles away from you.

If the enemy decides to run away you have two options - give up or chase him across the map for the rest of the game, because there are exactly 0 ways to stop them. You can hook into them, but all that will achieve is that you'll have to stand still for another 5 seconds while the enemy keeps running, because it stuns them for microsecond, while you slowly fall down and then wait for the afteranimation cooldown to end before you can chase.

The fights themselves are a chaotic mess, since characters have super short bursts of speed that can be used indefinitely. So they can just roll around while you try and fail to even target them.

Also wait times are atrocious. Up to 10 minutes waiting for a match during day time

Played Naraka when it launched and really enjoyed the game but was struggling with mouse & keyboard controls and vpn users abusing the ping advantage not to mention straight up ch**ters. I came back to the game on & off and still felt not much had changed. I decided to play again this current Season 7 and overall been having a lot more fun in the game than i had before. The balance of bots and real players feels similar to CoD DMZ which i really enjoy, currently platinum rank in trios with the #1 Yoto in my town. I played competitive street fighter for a few years and this game is possibly the closest thing to Cap-com's classic & Tenchu mixed together. There are still some ping abusers but overall feels a lot more balanced than it did before with the addition of game pass. I recommend it to anyone who likes fighting games, be prepared for a very tall skill ceiling, you will get destroyed at first. I got into Genshin Impact and that has helped my m&k skill coming from controllers and recommend that to new players before getting into a game like this.

A melee-focused BR that features a wide variety of movesets and characters. The gameplay seems simple at first, but the parry and ability to delay attacks, along with modifying moves with the Soulgem system adds a lot of depth to it. The monetization is a bit much for not being a F2P, but the thing that makes this bearable is full progression in the Bot Mode. I just don't have the time to dedicate myself to a single game, so being able to progress at my own pace and enjoy the game on a casual level is what makes this the only BR I've actually enjoyed since PUBG's first release. I hear that this game sucks if you're trying to play it against other people like a normal BR, but I have to thank 24 Entertainment for allowing people like me to enjoy the game. I'm still buying the cosmetics and battle passes too, so more BR devs should really follow in this game's footsteps in this regard. ‚ô•

"We advise you install the game on an SSD for a more streamlined experience." Sounded like a mere suggestion, in reality this game can ONLY be played on an SSD. My WD Black hard drive died right after playing this game for 5 mins top. It was under a year old so I got a new one for "free" easily. I would had never tried to play this game on an HDD if they simply were 100% honest and said they made this game to be played on an SSD only.

What really grinds my gears is that I reached out to the devs, no respond. I posted here about the issue and on the sub reddit, my post got removed within minutes. The concept of this game sounds amazing but the devs are shady, I just upgraded my PC - using an SSD now but now I don't feel like i can trust this game/devs.

Only played a few hours and I'm already having a lot of fun!

Game has a ton of problems.

They want to censor skins after they were released already, after people already bought them which is a massive red flag from this developer. This alone should cause caution or refusal to purchase from their ridiculous in game cash shop

The monetization is loot boxes and constantly tries to nickel and dime the playerbase despite being a pay to play game

The game is loaded on "infinite" combos of which the devs have had plenty of time to fix and just have not done so. There is actual combos in the game, but there is little reason to do them when you can just throw an infinite and guarantee the kill. While in some cases they have to have specific circumstances such as flat terrain this isn't the case for every character/weapon nor is this an excuse to leave infinites in the game, those who defend this use the infinites themselves and usually can't win fights without them to begin with.

The game is immensely imbalanced with some characters just having clear edge over the rest of the roster entirely and in some cases like the greatsword being able to charge up a vertical level 3 and 1 shot you even in the highest tier armors while you can parry it, the ability to 1 shot or infinite isn't the players fault, it is the devs for not actually caring to balance the game for proper competitive play. Infinites and 0hko in this kind of game should never be an issue.

The game is littered with chinese VPN users which is where a huge portion of the population is coming from on the charts of which be ready to face extensive lag and desync. Despite this being against terms of service and regulations, nothing is done or will be done about this. 

The Servers themselves are just not that good nor are the hitboxes, expect weird happenings such as being hit when you are behind your target, parried even though you swung at a different target, smallest adjustments to height causing your weapon to whiff for no reason even though animation wise the weapon visibly connects, etc

The games ranked systems and matchmaking will pair you with players way above your skill threshold, Bronze ranks can fight gold and above. Don't expect to be properly matched up against people of equal skill

Game doesn't explain itself all that well and you will find yourself digging around for information, the Wiki provided in game is completely outdated and unusable. Expect yourself to be studying from other players on how to play this game and it's movement mechanics and combos

If You don't have a solid state drive or better expect massive issues with crashing, stuttering, lag, etc due to awful optimizations. The game will actually warn you if you launch from a regular hard drive that the game is recommended to be on a solid state. Considering how many games out there run just fine on a hard drive this is the devs poor excuse for being lazy on it's optimization to run better.

Console players are at disadvantage due to input issues and lower frame rates, despite this we have crossplay that is mandatory turned on and cannot be turned off on steam but can be shut off on consoles, which creates an unfair atmosphere

There is bots galore even in ranked mode which gives a false sense of superiority and creates bad habits, half the time you won't know if it's a player or not just starting out till you realize just how braindead the bots are. There is a way to turn off bots on the xbox versions but not the steam version. Once you play a lot you will run into more players, but this is also a unique way to get you past that 2 hour limit of play time so you can no longer refund the game and see all the glaring issues.

Voice acting is dreadful and gets annoying after a while, especially when your in loading screens and your characters say the exact same line to each other every single time you go in a loading screen with your friend

Game is more centered around rock paper scissors and movement, abusing "focus" which is a form of super armor in a way, proceeding to whoever gets the hit in will just throw you into an infinite, while there is ways to get out of the infinite all they have to do is land another attack and your back in the "combo". Landing another attack is simple when attacks cause you to fly across the screen and hit them at ridiculous ranges.

Map is far too large for such a small group of players and a lot of times you will find yourself mindlessly wandering around trying to find someone, the community seems to instead prefer to all spawn in the same regions but this isn't an excuse for this design. Bots will randomly teleport to your location to keep things "active" and then randomly die later to the gas due to poor AI

The game suffers from cheaters all the same with the VPN's flooding over here and just doing the same here, videos on teleportation among other exploitative cheats are a thing you may encounter next to lag switching and the regular desync.

TLDR: Rating: 5.5/10. Fun, but flawed.

Game is fun for a few games in a session especially with friends. There's lot of in game events, which is nice. The character customization is nice as well (you have to grind/pay for a lot of the stuff on the customization tho). 

Too heavy on gacha for a game i have to pay for, but these are purely cosmetic so you don't have to spend any extra money if you don't want to.
However the gacha is really scummy, so be mentally prepared to spend a lot of money if you want the rarest cosmectics (or hope to get really lucky).
 
Technical side: FPS problems with RTX 30XX cards. Had to create a firewall exception to play the game, had issues with wifi connection after i did this. Also the game tries hard to gather your personal information, which is just bizarre (this does require your consent tho).

Gameplay wise: There's A LOT of bots. Parry mechanic feels off. There's a big power gap between different player levels, which is stupid in a battle royale game.

The game has a lot of good ideas with subpar execution. If you want to play a melee combat focused battle royale game, Naraka is the best one out there, even with all it's horrendous flaws.

Pros:

++ Melee combat focused battle royale.
+ Game is fun for few games at a time, especially with friends in the team mode.
+ The battle pass refunds the in game currency, if you complete it.
+ PvE Game mode is actually not that bad, another fun for a few games at a time mode where you smack some monsters and it has a pretty nice difficulty curve.
+ In game events
+ Looks good
+ Character customization
+ Controller & cross platform support.
+ All heroes are unique, both gameplay & visual/audio design.

Cons:

--- I have to disable my firewall to play the game (wtf?)
--- Personal info gathering
--- Too much gacha in a game i have to pay for.
-- Scummy gacha.
-- FPS problems with RTX 30XX cards
-- BOTS
--- Survival mode is really boring at times, there's nothing to do on the map and there's too few players
--- Big empty maps
- Parry mechanic feels off
- Targeting assistance is really wonky at times, you can disable tho.
-- Player level difference bonus is huge
-- RNG on looted items
-- PvE is only available on weekends between certain hours. You can't just log in with your friends and play it.
- You have to log in every day for events/passes/etc. You can't play whenever you want to if you want to complete them.
-- Event pass is obviously rigged, to try to push you into buying levels (the levels are REALLY expensive)
- Projectiles don't travel like you'd expect them to.
- Grappling hook collision.
- Trees
- Cliffside combat.
- Can't play with fist weapons/hand to hand combat in a wuxia game (really?)
- Cross platform problems
- Can't change character skill loadout in game, this has to be done in queue/before you queue.
- Heavily limited access to cosmetics without spending extra money.
- Chinese smurfs.
- All cosmetics are locked to a single hero. You can't cross customize with any of your cosmetics, which honestly sucks.

All the negative reviews that cite the issue with Chinese players ruining the game for the NA/EU audience could not be more true. I read them, bought the game anyway to give it a shot and your very first public match you'll be greeted to just how bad it is trying to play against someone from China using a VPN. You can't hit them, you can't counter them and they'll land 100% of their abilities on you no problem. 

The fact that more of an effort hasn't been taken to remove these players using VPN's, lag-switches and other nefarious methods to get the upper hand in this game shows just how little the Dev's care about porting this game to the west. It's to the point when you queue into a match, just look for the players with Chinese characters in their name and you'll already find the winners of each round.

Couple the above with the fact that this game is basically a melee-clone of Apex Legends with a generic "eastern" theme and suffers from the same lack of new maps (any), that Apex did for months means you'll get tired of the same play each time. 

If getting face-rolled for hours on end by Chinese players in an apex-knockoff battle-royal game is your jam, then 10/10 this is for you. For everyone else thats sane and isn't a masochist, look elsewhere.

**UPDATE: 12 FEB 23**
At the urging of a friend I picked this game back up because he said, and I quote, "they changed the game a lot! It's a lot more friendly to new players now!" allow me to enlighten you all to what new player friendly is for this game developer...

-There's now a rating system for ranked matches, think arena rating and MMR from like WoW if you played. You start of at like Bronze V and work your way down numerically V, IV, III, II, I, etc until you're in the next bracket so on and so forth. 

In theory, this means you're only supposed to go against other players around your same MMR, hence keeping the Chinese players that have no-life'd this game from its inception out of your games, right? Wrong. 

There's so few players in that low MMR (low bronze for new players) that the queue times for those matches  would be astronomical so what did the Dev's do? They fill those low-ranked matches with bots, ez-mode bots, in ranked matches. However they give the bots random names like Taitai2000$ and other randomness so you think you're playing against other players and giving you the "feel" like the MMR system is working. It gives you the illusion that you'll be able to work your way up the brackets and -gradually- face stronger players as your own skills improve. Its a farce. From Bronze V to Bronze II it's nothing but bots with the occasional other NA player in the same boat as you. There's even a badly translated tooltip on one of the screens that reads something along the lines of "robotic players decrease as you ascend through each stage". The whole thing is designed to catch you and make you think you're successful. 

-Then we get into Bronze II, I and Silver Tiers and above. This is where you encounter the carries. Chinese players back again in full force, tanking their own MMR, or queuing with brand new accounts that sit AFK in party so it drags their main account down into your MMR so they can fight you for the ez-wins. So what does this all mean? The game is still not region locked. You still fight players from China and all over the world and fight their internet connections, their lag, and their no-life status on the game. Instead of region locking the game like many NA players have called for the Dev's create this fake MMR system. A system designed to pull the wool over your eyes, and make you believe you're actually achieving something. In reality all you're doing is being prepared as fodder for "far eastern" players who are either too bad, or too bored of playing against each other that they want to ruin your gaming experience instead.

So I've had a real hard time finding a BR that I liked.  This is the first one that really pulled me in.  Maybe in part because it's the first time I've played on with such an emphasis on melee.  And I was having a real good time with it too.  I was focusing on achievements though, and I think that's what eventually killed it for me.  There are a pair that require you get a melee and ranged weapon to level 25, and the time it takes to do this is unforgivable.  I was focusing specifically on the ranged weapon one and it kind of took all the fun out of it.  Yes, I could have just said screw it and started playing normally again, but as any completionist would agree, that just wasn't going to sit well.  So I think I'm done.  I put a good chunk of time into it and bought the game on sale for like 10 bucks.  So I can't really complain, it was totally worth the money.  I just wish the weapon level achievements weren't so impossibly hard to reach.

I've played many battleroyale type of games. Naraka is definitely very different than other titles. 
1st of all melee weapons are an major point in the game. I am very doubtful that you will be able to win an entire match based only on range weapons (if it comes to solo queue). 
All the characters have their own abilities,  just as I've seen in other most recent BR games.
Graphically games is a gem, of course if you can run it on your PC that is on max settings, but even on lower settings it looks amazing. People are mostly playing as a team in matches like duos and trios, but I've had some teammates  running their own path in those matches (most of the time it won't happen). 
Most important [u]no p2w[/u]. Everything is purely cosmetics. 
Fights are engaging, hard to master, but you can do it in your own pace. 
In my opinion best BR on the market so far. I can highly recommend you that title. Very addictive.

Massive EDIT: After throwing myself into playing, learning the tips and tricks, and moving up a little in ranks, I've found great joy in my 100 and something hours playing the game. 

Disagreements:      I'll have to say, some people say the movement is bad, clunky, that it's too hard to play or learn, or there is not enough payout in general. I stand on the other side of the fence to say that is incorrect. Once you get things down, fights are exciting. lol. I haven't been excited in a game for a long time, like, heated excited when massive fights break out and people are flying everyone. XD 

Agreements:     Chinese (I apologize in advance, though the truth) need to stay on their server. The high ping is a disruption to NA players and can ultimately turn away a lot of players. Not due to the game being too hard or can't learn, but really the issue in lag where you can even parry on time, and the other person saw nothing and was able to rock your world. It's a situation that I believe will be the downfall for Naraka if they do not fix this asap since it has turned away some of the audience for NA already.

Final Thoughts : The game is great, I love it and will continue to get better and be a Chinese player killer. lol.  A few things to note though, are there is ranking, quickplay, and a Bloodbath mode when you reach level 10.
DO. NOT. SLEEP. ON. Bloodbath mode, nor training. 
Bloodbath is a 8 man fight to the death with fast raises so you are in and out of the fight and get solid practice.
Training is a EXCELLENT way to learn the items in game, use them and get a understanding of them, and even have a advanced bot you can fight that will do a few tricks players will use so you can adapt better in situations. 

P.S. Don't button mash....You will get parried. XD

P.S.S Lootboxes are ass drop rates, and super pricey. Everyone has to make money, but this is a bit much. In today's age, money is a hard source to come by (enough) to even live here in the US (can't speak for anywhere else). So people are not really for lootboxes unless feeling rich. Even Genshin Impact you have better chances at the top grade drop for less so, that's food for thought on the lootbox systems.

This game is my favorite Battle Royale game by far. Partly because it's not your typical battle royale game. It blends fighting games, which I like, with the battle royale genre, and I think it works quite well. I feel like this game hasn't gotten the attention it deserves. The devs are constantly updating, making balance changes (usually for the better), and the cosmetics are absolutely gorgeous. 10/10 game.

It's not perfect, and does have some issues, particularly with VPN users from other regions with very high ping making some fights unfair, but overall I've enjoyed my time with this game.

I really like this game since I started playing. 

Sure you get bot lobbies at start a lot, even when higher rank there are still some bots here and there. But I have been fighting against a lot of real players too. It really depends on which time you play this game for now, since the playerbase in the EU is low. 

I really like the visuals and that you can learn a lot of skills/movement/combo's in this game. It has a lot variety of weapons and also characters with different abilities that you can also customize (skills, character, outifits, accessoires ect) to make the character your own character. 

Playing in custom lobbies with friends is also a great way to practice when either the queue time is a bit low or you just want to get better. 

I would rate it 8/10

It is worth but keep in mind that you have to invest a lot of time in this game and that you will be getting destroyed at the begining after leaving the first BOT-lobbys. The only thing i can tell you here is dont get tilted and dont give up. Its worth trust me.

Here some quick beginner tips:

Watch some Guides even tho most of them are outdatet they still give very usefull information.

Also look for bloodbath and 1v1 Custom matches in the beginning as much as possible to get used to the fighting system so you dont have the tilt by going to loot for 8 hours only to get destroyed over and over again without any learning effect.

Movement is key in this game and makes 60 % of the skill difference, maybe even more. So after learning the basic fighting you need to learn how to move efficently. It actually is also 50 % of the fun in this game, since you are doing it all the time. Furthermore you dont get bored while on the look out for enemys in the battleroyale mode.

NARAKA: BLADEPOINT blows fresh air onto the Battle Royale genre. The focus on responsive melee combat is unique and a personal favorite. Outside of the brutal monetization, I have no complaints and will continue to play and support this game. I strongly recommend going Free To Play and lowering the costs of the Treasures in-game.

Reels you in when playing against lower tier players/bots (which they even put in ranked play under plat) but between latency differences causing attacks/abilities to literally phase through people, 1 shot mechanics along with perfect combos ( this isn't even getting into duos or trios when there are more than 1 people attacking you). and absolutely awful movement gameplay that doesn't even work half of the time, this is a completely worthless piece of coding and an awful game that deserves to be trashed completely.

I would like to say that the amount of times I've got sh#t on in this game are just making me stronger and my will to live gets smaller 

10/10

This game has a really nice learning curve, you actually get rewarded for the time you put in and see the fruits of your labor. 

I love the aestethic of the game and the different filter options it has (so you can customize the looks fitting to your liking should you have a strong enough pc) 

The combat is simple but complex enough for every taste and every mechanic has counterplay. 

There was never a time i felt like i couldnt do anything about anything its always shit i could have dodged then go for a light attack etc. 

I like games like these really much and i enjoy it. 

Some people say there are bots or it is a dead game which is not the case at all i really recommend you trying it out there are pvp modes:

Battle royal
Arena
PVE 
and everything is connected to reward systems that you can either buy for money or just grind. 

There is a gamepass for it which is really good value but i myself never bought anything for money except the core game for like 30 bucks. 
 
I have nice aestethic freedom due to the customizer tool for skin facecial features etc. 

The team really puts in effort to make the game balanced and i think it is. 

SO far i've played like 10 games in gold of which i've won the past 6 as 1 rank and i gotta say it feels so rewarding once you understand the system to a detail. 

For example now there is a ashen katana that is only available through grinding quests and it actually rewards you for putting in the time(to my knowledge not even buyable throug money) 
so it gives you the sense of prestige if you want it. 

I love this game highly recommend even tho there are frustrating learning moments not gonna lie.

Most unique battle royal game out there. Instead of being a first person shooter it plays more like a high mobility arena fighting game with lots of variety in play styles due to great weapon and character diversity and design. Would highly recommend to people who like action combat, arena fighters , or the idea of battle royals but haven't been able to find one they liked yet.

It's a fun game, but it has issues. Most notably for me, once you get to platinum rank or above (solo queue), it seems like everyone just uses daggers and nunchucks. Reason being, they're spammy and almost impossible to react to if you know how to abuse them. Which makes sense why they're used, but I feel like it's bad game design to have such cheap weapons in the game. All of the other weapons have obvious counterplay and seem mostly balanced.

It's also dead in the West, so expect games full of bots until you get to platinum rank or above.

Really like the game but its too difficult for a casual like me. There are so many "cheesy" moves that take away from the core game play experience. Sweaty players willing to spend hours watching youtube and practicing for hours on end will excel. I'll die because I'm never going to dedicate the time to learn all those undocumented, unintentional cheese moves. For example, you can sprint, then crouch while sliding and jump, to move faster than someone just using the intended "sprint" method (shift-W). 

It's a shame because everything else about the game is amazing, but I don't see casuals being any good.

I'd love to buy again if these are are resolved.

After seeing this game on the store I tried it out. Usually I'm not fond of battle royales, they're annoying, tedious and just feels poor when you would lose. Naraka's combat however is very similar to one of my favorite martial arts games (Nioh & Nioh 2). With several different activities to choose from, a parry system that you can use to your advantage when you don't have a similar rarity weapon, the tide of battle can change incredibly quickly. This game is fully worth trying out especially if you've also played Nioh or Nioh 2.

Very good game, it is undeniable that it is plenty of fun and engaging competition but has multiple issues for computers that do not have as much gear; even though all settings are set to low, expect a number of micro stutters, seconds-long stutters, random error messages stating that files were corrupted (even after reinstallation) or losing connecting, bad render and others. 

I wholeheartedly recommend the game for players with good rigs and willingness to learn its mechanics. If your computer is not as powerful (for example, GTX 1060 and an i5) you can still play the game and have fun just have the expectancy of having to deal with the aforementioned issues. I only wish the game's performance issues were addressed and that the support team provided helpful insights or information to solve such problems.

Other problems were imbalances that i notice. some Players that have played a while were in the quick match games that could move and dodge way faster then new players. grapple longer and quicker as well.  Also customer service was not working, along with text, and customization. 24 entertainment said they were fixing it but its been a week and nothing. So here's my two cents

Cons: Medium to very Long wait times
          Text still didn't work
          Type any word into customer service and nothing helps

It is a fun over the top wuxia style melee focused BR game. There are, as of writing this review, 13 heroes who have 3 versions of a primary ability and 3 version of an ultimate ability. In solos there may be some that are stronger than others but duos/trios allows for a lot of flexibility and wombos. The weapons have neat and varied movesets and the combat feels rewarding once you start to get the hang of it. Movement is pretty quick with the grappling hook once you learn the techniques. 

While the cosmetics are expensive, you can get a decent amount without microtransactions over time. Each hero can be character customized with a pretty decent character creator. You can go as far as to make some unholy abominations of characters if that is what you are into. 

When you start you will be playing with some bots as it adjusts to your skill level. I thought it was a bit weird at first but after a few matches you'll start getting placed with players. Matches seem to be mostly around 50 players for me. There are a few different game modes to play in as well. 

Over all I've been surprised with how much I've enjoyed the game. When you pull of a cool play with the movement system or the counter attacks it is incredibly satisfying.

My favorite game rn, melee based BR with a ton of other modes like FFA bloodbath, 16-man 1v1 mode bloodsport, casual mini games like Through the Fire fall guys crossover, and a campaign mode. The look and combat of the game is like no other, you cant compare it to any other game since its like a melee br with Overwatch abilities, the BR aspect makes combat so random that no 2 games are the same. The aesthetics, skins, maps, character customizations, etc also make the game unique. Its combat is rare in its grappling, combos, vertical/horizontal attacks, characters, abilities etc. The look of the game is uncommon to others. The production value of very high, they just release a huge update for the map like 3 months ago and just came out with a huge extension for the campaign mode. 

Obviously issues with lag but i dont have an SSD. They should have released  the BR for free and added DLCs for the mini-game fall guys crossover, campaign or bloodsport.

My thoughts after playing this for a longtime.

I like Naraka's setup, its design and combat systems are cool and it takes sometime to get used to the way its defense is played. The Ranking-System is a bit off, since in almost every match "EU" there is 1 to 5 much higher ranked player present and those usually destroy me in under 5sec with no chance of even getting in a hit, that's frustrating yes, but its a PvP game so . . . normal :)
All in all i can say i like to play Naraka, as a standard Battleroyal game its a nice asset to the genre!

This games monetization however including its RNG setup concerning loot-boxes and prices for Skins "mostly just re-skins" is absolutely appalling. And now adding to this an Addon that servers no real value to the game and charging no small amount of money for that is as well just sickening.

So to answer your Question why none of my friends play this game, because the answer is: Its a Chinese game man, they make it a principal to try to make you pay for everything and we don't like that!

They like the game, but they do not like your monetization. That said seeing how you are charging for the Asura DLC and for every season to come, in which you give basically no chance to obtain the loot by playing, even if one play's a lot i might take my leave of this game as well, its getting silly.

Sadly another game done correctly and screw up because of money . . . . . quite often these days!

The game is quite fun actually. But it has a huge learning curve that's really hard for new players to get used to. Many hard mechanics weren't explained in the tutorial, and you either have to figure them out after a long period of trial and error or search on youtube for player-made guides. These are basic knowledge required for competing against other players, so, they are VERY important. When you get used to everything and start getting the hang of it, the game becomes a lot more enjoyable, especially with friends. 
Why i didn't recommended it was because the lastest Xmas update had messed the game up, lag spikes, fps drop and input lag was the worst of it. My PC was average and could run the game smoothly before the update, and all the mentioned problems didn't even occur.
